comments.author: Jennifer
comments.content: If you don't own a pressure cooker, what are your thoughts on simply oven roasting the pumpkin?

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: I think it will be great. Don't use the baking soda of course, just roast as usual. I'd use a bit larger chunks so they don't dry out too much and roast at say 375 until nice and brown and caramelized and tender.

comments.author: jaime @ asweetroad
comments.content: Hmmm, I was just talking about warm pumpkin pie with ice cream earlier today. I wonder if pumpkin pie + pumpkin ice cream is overkill....

comments.author: Sammy
comments.content: I found your recipe totally surprising and generally wonderful! I have a kiddies hand-held ice-cream churner bought in Japan by a friend of mine and my daughter and I just had great fun yesterday churning and eating...thanks!!

comments.author: Shikha @ Shikha la mode
comments.content: Great recipe! I'm always scared of buying a pumpkin and cooking it so I always get the puree. Any tips?

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: It is a good idea to buy a pumpkin that is known to be good for baking; anyone working in a produce department should be able to steer you towards it. Then just be careful cutting it up, be sure your hands are always out of the direction of danger in case you slip. Oh, and use your biggest spoon for scooping out the seeds once it is halved or quartered. Good luck!

comments.author: amy@currylime
comments.content: What a lovely ice cream for fall!

comments.author: Denise
comments.content: Someone just told me about your blog and also "Cooking With Mr. C." on Facebook. I will check your blog out.  Denise

comments.author: Ice Cream Magic
comments.content: Thanks for the tip. Cooking the pumpkin with a bit of baking soda to increase the pH seems like a good idea. Nice post.

comments.author: Brian Redder
comments.content: Sounds like a great ice cream flavor!

comments.author: terry
comments.content: I was thinking this pumpkin ice cream would be good on top of granola ;) looking forward to giving it the taste test. Thanks for the recipe ;)
